get.summary: Get a list of all payment accounts the user has access to.
get.description: Authorization: End user or Merchant token (IP address whitelisted) is required.

parameters.name: merchantID
parameters.description: The merchantID of the accounts to retrieve.

parameters.name: connectedAccounts
parameters.description: Optional include connected accounts along with payment accounts.

parameters.name: onlyConnectAccounts
parameters.description: Only return connected accounts

parameters.name: includeArchived
parameters.description: Flag that indicates whether to fetch archived accounts or not.

post.summary: Creates a new merchant payment account.
post.description: Authorization: End user or Merchant token is required. User permissions required: CanCreateAccounts

requestBody.description: The details of the payment account to create.

201.description: The payment account was successfully created and is ready to use.

202.description: The payment account was created but the is not yet ready to use.

get.summary: Get a paged list of all payment accounts the user has access to for a specific merchant.
get.description: Authorization: End user or Merchant token (IP address whitelisted) is required.

parameters.name: merchantID
parameters.description: The merchantID of the accounts to retrieve.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Optional. Array. If specified will only return accounts for these currencies.

parameters.name: connectedAccounts
parameters.description: Optional include connected accounts along with payment accounts.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Optional. The page number to retrieve.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Optional. The number of accounts per page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The text filter to apply to retrieve accounts with a similar account name, IBAN etc.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Optional expression to sort the order of the accounts. Example "AvailableBalance desc,Inserted asc".

parameters.name: onlyConnectAccounts
parameters.description: Only return connected accounts

parameters.name: onlyArchived
parameters.description: Flag that indicates whether to fetch only archived accounts or not.

parameters.name: includeArchived
parameters.description: Flag that indicates whether to fetch archived accounts or not.

200.description: Returns the list of accounts for the merchant.

get.summary: Get a list of the transactions for a single payment account.

parameters.description: The number of transactions per page.

parameters.name: toDate

verifying the HMAC HTTP request authentication.

            HMAC HTTP authentication headers added.

            HMAC HTTP authentication headers added.

            method can indicate that the payer needs to be sent to the issuing bank for authentication.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the payment request the card payment is being submitted for.

JwtToken.description:
The tokenised Card Number and CardVerification Number (CVN) details.
Typically generated by the CyberSource javascript library.

PartialAmount.description:
Optional partial payment amount. If not specified then the full payment request
amount will be attempted.

The ID of the tokenised card to use for the payment. The merchant needs to ensure that
the use of the tokenised card is restricted to the same customer that created it.

PaymentInitiator.description: Indicates who initiated the card token payment, customer or merchant.

CardSecurityCode.description:
Not used for merchant initiated transactions. Optional for customer initiated transactions.
If supplied will be sent to the card processor as a check that the customer using the  
tokenised card knows the card verification number.

PartialAmount.description:
Optional partial payment amount. If not specified then the full payment request
amount will be attempted.

200.description: Returns a card payment response model that indicates the result of the payment attempt.

post.summary: Creates a payment request record and processes the payment.
post.description: Authorization: End user or Merchant token is required. User permissions required: CanCreatePaymentRequests

PaymentRequestCreate.MerchantID.description: The ID of the merchant to create the payment request for.

PaymentRequestCreate.Amount.description: The amount of money to request.

PaymentRequestCreate.Currency.description: The currency of the payment request.

PaymentRequestCreate.CustomerID.description:
An optional customer identifier for the payment request. This field is sent to the 
payer's bank when using payment initiation. The restriction in the available characters
is due to some banks rejecting requests when ones outside the set are used.

PaymentRequestCreate.OrderID.description:
An optional order ID for the payment request. If the request is for an invoice this
is the most appropriate field for the invoice ID.

PaymentRequestCreate.PaymentMethodTypes.description:
The payment methods that the payment request supports. When setting using form data
should be supplied as a comma separated list, for example "card, pisp, lightning".

PaymentRequestCreate.PaymentMethods.description: The payment methods that the payment request supports.

PaymentRequestCreate.Description.description:
An optional description for the payment request. If set this field will appear
on the transaction record for some card processors.

PaymentRequestCreate.PispAccountID.description:
The payment account ID to use to receive payment initiation payments. This must match one of your
NoFrixion payment account IDs. This can be left blank to use your default payment account.

PaymentRequestCreate.ShippingFirstName.description: Optionally the first name of the customer's shipping address.

PaymentRequestCreate.ShippingLastName.description: Optionally the last name of the customer's shipping address.

PaymentRequestCreate.ShippingAddressLine.description: Optionally the first line of the customer's shipping address.
Optionally the second line of the customer's shipping address.

PaymentRequestCreate.ShippingAddressCity.description: Optionally the city of the customer's shipping address.

PaymentRequestCreate.ShippingAddressCoun.description: Optionally the state or county of the customer's shipping address.

PaymentRequestCreate.ShippingAddressPost.description: Optionally the post code of the customer's shipping address.

PaymentRequestCreate.ShippingAddressCoun.description: Optionally the country code of the customer's shipping address.

PaymentRequestCreate.ShippingPhone.description: Optionally the shipping phone number for the customer.

PaymentRequestCreate.ShippingEmail.description: Optionally the shipping email address for the customer.

PaymentRequestCreate.BaseOriginUrl.description:
For card payments the origin of the payment page needs to be set in advance.
A public key context is generated to encrypt sensitive card details and is bound
to a single origin URL.

PaymentRequestCreate.CallbackUrl.description:
Once a payment is processed, or a notification of an inbound payment is received,
a callback request will be made to this URL. Typically it will be the page on
a merchant's web site that displays the results of the payment attempt.

PaymentRequestCreate.FailureCallbackUrl.description:
Optional callback URL for payment failures that can occur when the payer is 
redirected away from the payment page. Typically the payer is only sent away
from the payment page for pay by bank attempts. If this URL is not set the 
payer will be redirected back to the original URL the payment attempt was initiated
from.

PaymentRequestCreate.SuccessWebHookUrl.description:
If a payment event results in the payment request being classified as fully paid this
success webhook URL will be invoked. The URL will be invoked as a GET request, i.e.
 there will be no request body. Two query parameters will be added to the URL. The 
first one will be "id" and will hold the payment request ID. The second one will be
"orderid" and will hold the payment request OrderID, note the OrderID could be empty
if it was not set when the payment request was created. 
The recommended approach when receiving a success web hook is to use the "id" parameter
to call the moneymoov get payment request endpoint to retrieve the full details of the
payment request and check the status. Web hooks can be easily spoofed and should not be
relied upon.

PaymentRequestCreate.CardAuthorizeOnly.description:
For card payments the default behaviour is to authorise and capture the payment at the same
time. If a merchant needs to authorise and then capture at a later point this property needs 
to be set to true.

PaymentRequestCreate.CardCreateToken.description:
For card payments a payment attempt can be used to create a reusable token for subsequent
payments. Setting this field to true will create a reusable customer token.

PaymentRequestCreate.CardCreateTokenMode.description:
This specifies whether user consent will be taken before tokenising card or not.
This cannot be 'None' if CardCreateToken is set to true. If this is set to 'UserConsentRequired'
then, the user consent will overwrite CardCreateToken flag on submit card payment.

PaymentRequestCreate.CardTransmitRawDeta.description:
If set to true for card payments the sensitive card number and card verification number 
will be transmitted directly rather than being tokenised. This makes the payment quicker
 but more exposed to client side flaws such as cross site scripting.

PaymentRequestCreate.CardProcessorMercha.description:
Optional field that if specified indicates the processor merchant ID that should be used
to process any card payments. Mainly useful where a merchant has multiple processor
merchant ID's. If left empty the default merchant card settings will be used.

PaymentRequestCreate.IgnoreAddressVerifi.description:
If set to true the card payment gateway will be directed to proceed with a payment even if the
address verification checks fails.

PaymentRequestCreate.CardIgnoreCVN.description:
If set to true the card payment gateway will be directed to proceed with a payment even if the
card verification number check fails.

PaymentRequestCreate.PispRecipientRefere.description:
For Payment Initiation payments this is the reference that will be requested to used as the reference 
on the your transaction record. Note that it is not guaranteed that the sending bank will use this
reference and in practice it has been observed to be supported by only half to two thirds of banks.

PaymentRequestCreate.UseHostedPaymentPag.description:
If set to true, and the merchant is configured for hosted payment pages, the base and callback URLs
will be set to use the hosted payment page.

PaymentRequestCreate.CardNoPayerAuthenti.description:
If set to true for card payments no attempt will be made to use payer authentication (3-D Secure and equivalent). 
Skipping payer authentication can help avoid failed payment attempts when a payer is not enrolled or when they
can't be bothered completing their issuing bank's authentication steps. A disadvantage is it exposes the merchant 
to liability for charge backs.

PaymentRequestCreate.PartialPaymentMetho.description: The approach to use, or not, for accepting partial payments.

PaymentRequestCreate.CustomerEmailAddres.description:
Optional email address for the customer. If the tokenise card option is set then the customer email address
is mandatory.

PaymentRequestCreate.PaymentProcessor.description: Lists the supported card and PIS processors.

PaymentRequestCreate.PriorityBankID.description: The ID of the bank that is set as the priority bank for display on pay element.

PaymentRequestCreate.Title.description:
A generic field to contain any additional data that the merchant wishes to store against the payment request.
 E.g. product or service information.

PaymentRequestCreate.PartialPaymentSteps.description:
An optional comma separated list of partial payment amounts. The amounts represent guidance, or suggestions, as to 
how the payer will be requested to make partial payments.

PaymentRequestCreate.PayrunID.description: Optional, if set it indicates that this payment request will be used to top up a payment account for a pay run.

PaymentRequestCreate.SandboxSettleDelayI.description:
Sandbox only. Optional. If set, the simulated Direct Debit settlement will be delayed by the specified number of seconds. 
Must be greater than 0 and less than 600. Otherwise, the default value will be used.

PaymentRequestCreate.TagIds.description: An optional list of tag ids to add to the payment request

PaymentRequestCreate.Tags.description:
An optional list of tag values to set on the payment request. If no matching
tag exists it will be created.

PaymentRequestCreate.AutoSendReceipt.description: If set to true, a receipt will be automatically sent to the CustomerEmailAddress when payments are received.

PaymentRequestCreate.CustomFields.description:
A list of custom fields to add to the payment request. The custom fields
are data type agnostic which means that the API will not do any validation or formatting
in the key-value pairs. The API will store the custom fields as is.

PaymentRequestCreate.DueDate.description: An optional due date for the payment request.

PaymentRequestCreate.FieldDisplaySetting.description:
An optional display settings for the payment request fields. This allows the merchant to control how
the fields are displayed on the hosted payment page, receipt, etc.

PaymentRequestCreate.NotificationRoleIDs.description:
An optional list of notification role IDs that will receive notifications
about the payment request. This is useful for roles that need to be notified
about payment request events.

CardSensitive.JwtToken.description:
The JWT token is not used if the raw card details are provided. This
property is to override the base card property and stop it being required.

CardSensitive.NumberToken.description:
The Number Token is not used if the raw card details are provided. This
property is to override the base card property and stop it being required.

CardSensitive.CvcToken.description:
The Cvc Token is not used if the raw card details are provided. This
property is to override the base card property and stop it being required.

CardSensitive.PartialAmount.description:
Optional partial payment amount. If not specified then the full payment request
amount will be attempted.

Card.JwtToken.description:
The tokenised Card Number and CardVerification Number (CVN) details.
Typically generated by the CyberSource javascript library.

Card.PartialAmount.description:
Optional partial payment amount. If not specified then the full payment request
amount will be attempted.

PaymentMethod.description: The single payment method to use for the pay on demand payment request.

CardToken.TokenisedCardID.description:
The ID of the tokenised card to use for the payment. The merchant needs to ensure that
the use of the tokenised card is restricted to the same customer that created it.

CardToken.PaymentInitiator.description: Indicates who initiated the card token payment, customer or merchant.

CardToken.CardSecurityCode.description:
Not used for merchant initiated transactions. Optional for customer initiated transactions.
If supplied will be sent to the card processor as a check that the customer using the  
tokenised card knows the card verification number.

CardToken.PartialAmount.description:
Optional partial payment amount. If not specified then the full payment request
amount will be attempted.

PaymentInitiationRequest.ProviderID.description: This is the ID of the institution (bank) that the payer ha chosen.

PaymentInitiationRequest.PartialAmount.description: Optional. If 0 the full amount is assumed.

PaymentInitiationRequest.OriginUrl.description:
Optional. If set should indicate the origin URL the payer is making the 
payment from. If a pay by bank attempt fails and the payment request does not
have a FailureCallbackUrl set then the payer will be redirected to this URL.

isPayerAuthenticationRequired.description: Gets set to true if 3-D Secure payer authentication is required for a payment.

isSoftDecline.description:
Gets set to true if the card processor flagged the transaction as having failed address or
card security number verification. If the payment was for a sale a soft decline will prevent
the transaction being captured. The merchant can set the ignore address verification flag 
if they want to allow soft declines to be accepted or false if not.

payerAuthenticationUrl.description:
If a card payment response indicates a 3-D Secure payer authentication is required
this field holds the URL to redirect the payer to their issuing bank.

payerAuthenticationAccessToken.description:
If a card payment response indicates a 3-D Secure payer authentication is required
this field holds the access token to POST when performing the redirect.

payerAuthenticationWindowWidth.description:
If a card payment response indicates a 3-D Secure payer authentication is required
this field holds the requested width of the iframe used to hold the challenge.

payerAuthenticationWindowHeight.description:
If a card payment response indicates a 3-D Secure payer authentication is required
this field holds the requested height of the iframe used to hold the challenge.

payerAuthenticationMerchantData.description:
If a card payment response indicates a 3-D Secure payer authentication this field may 
get set in order to transfer information back to the "authenticationcallback" method
that gets called automatically after a successful payer authentication attempt.

paymentRequestCallbackUrl.description:
The callback URL that was set when the payment request was created. Payers will be 
redirected to this URL after a successful card authorisation.

threeDSRedirectUrl.description:
Checkout.com require a redirect for 3DS authentication. This link will contain the 
link the payer needs to be redirected to.

type.description: The type of the account identifier.

summary.description: Summary of the account identifier's most important properties.

displaySummary.description: Summary of the account identifier's most important properties.

summary.description: Summary of the account identifier's most important properties.

approveUrl.description:
This field is used when returning a batch payout record to a client. If set it holds the URL
the user needs to visit in order to complete a strong authentication check in order to approve 
the batch payouts.

merchantID.description: Gets or Sets the merchant id.

name.description: The descriptive name for the beneficiary.

authorisations.description: A list of users who have successfully authorised the latest version of the beneficiary.

canAuthorise.description: True if the beneficiary can be authorised by the user who loaded it.

canUpdate.description: True if the beneficiary can be updated by the user who loaded it.

hasCurrentUserAuthorised.description: True if the beneficiary was loaded for a user and that user has already authorised the latest version of the beneficiary.

authorisersRequiredCount.description:
The number of authorisers required for this beneficiary. Is determined by business settings
on the source account and/or merchant.

authorisersCompletedCount.description: The number of distinct authorisers that have authorised the beneficiary.

authenticationMethods.description: A list of authentication types allowed to authorise the payout.

theirReference.description:
The reference that will be used by default as TheirReference when creating payouts to this beneficiary
if no TheirReference is specified for the payout.

theirReference.description:
Optional reference that will be used by default as TheirReference when creating payouts to this beneficiary 
if no TheirReference is specified for the payout.

sourceAccountsHash.description:
A hash of the source account ID's that are authorised to use the beneficiary.
An empty value means the beneficairy can be used by all the merchant's source
accounts.

merchantID.description: Gets or Sets the merchant id.

groupName.description: The descriptive name for the beneficiary group.

inserted.description: Timestamp indicating when the group was created.

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp indicating when the group was last updated.

beneficiaryID.description: The ID of the beneficiary for the membership.

beneficiaryGroupID.description: The ID of the beneficiary group for the membership.

inserted.description: Timestamp indicating when the group was created.

pageNumber.description: Current page number. Its 1 based. i.e firstpage is 1, secondpage is 2
Current page number. Its 1 based. i.e firstpage is 1, secondpage is 2

sourceAccountIDs.description: ID of the accounts which are authorised to act as a source for the beneficiary.

name.description: The descriptive name for the beneficiary.

theirReference.description:
The default reference that will be used by default as TheirReference when creating payouts to this beneficiary
if no TheirReference is specified for the payout.

id.description:
The unique ID of the card token that has been stored for the customer. This is 
the ID to supply when requesting an authorisation on behalf of the customer.

customerEmailAddress.description:
When creating a tokenised card the payer's email address must be supplied. This is
used as away to group card tokens for an end user. For customer initiated transactions 
it is important that the email address supplied has been verified to belong to the user
initiating the payment.

cardType.description:
The type of the tokenised card, e.g. Visa, MasterCard etc. It's possible this could
be empty if the card type could not be identified. There is no hard and fast way to
know for sure to know the type of card.

merchantID.description: The merchant ID for which the session timeout applies.

timeoutSeconds.description: The number of seconds a session for this user should last before expiring.

accountID.description:
An optional ID of an internal account the counterparty is associated with. If set
it will take precedence over any other destination details set for the counterparty.

internalAccountName.description: If the counterparty is an internal account, this is the name of the account.

beneficiaryID.description:
Optional ID of a Beneficiary to use for the counterparty destination. If set
it will take precedence over any other destination details, except for AccountID,
set for the counterparty.

name.description:
The name of the counterparty. For a person this should be their full name. For a 
company this should be their registered or trading name.

emailAddress.description:
An email address for the counterparty. Optional to set and depending on the payment
network does not always get set for pay ins.

phoneNumber.description:
A phone number for the counterparty. Optional to set and depending on the payment
network does not always get set for pay ins.

countryCode.description:
A country code for the counterparty. Optional to set and depending on the payment
network does not always get set for pay ins

summary.description: Gets a convenient summary representation of the counterparty.

accountID.description:
If set it indicates that the counterparty is an internal belonging to the 
same merchant as the source account.

beneficiaryID.description: If set it indicates that the counterparty is a beneficiary of the merchant.

name.description:
The name of the counterparty. For a person this should be their full name. For a 
company this should be their registered or trading name.

emailAddress.description:
An email address for the counterparty. Optional to set and depending on the payment
network does not always get set for pay ins.

phoneNumber.description:
A phone number for the counterparty. Optional to set and depending on the payment
network does not always get set for pay ins.

countryCode.description:
A country code for the counterparty. Optional to set and depending on the payment
network does not always get set for pay ins

summary.description: Gets a convenient summary representation of the counterparty.

fromDate.description: Minimum transaction date for the statement.

toDate.description: Maximum transaction date for the statement.

format.description: File format to save the statement as. Defaults to PDF.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.GenerateState.description: Model for generating a transaction statement.

externalInvoiceID.description: If this invoice was created from an external invoice, this will be the ID of the external invoice.

externalInvoiceProvider.description:
If this invoice was created from an external invoice, this will be the provider of the external invoice.
E.g., "Xero", "QuickBooks", etc.

merchantID.description: Internal ID of this mandate's merchant.

supplierName.description: Name of the supplier used to create this mandate.

supplierMandateID.description: ID that the supplier assigned to this mandate.

supplierBankAccountID.description:
ID that the supplier assigned to this mandate's
bank account.

supplierCustomerID.description:
ID that the supplier assigned to this mandate's
customer.

customerIban.description: Customer's IBAN in case of EUR account.

customerAccountNumber.description: Customer's account number in case of GBP account.

customerSortCode.description: Customer's sort code in case of GBP account.

isRecurring.description: Whether this mandate is single-use or recurring.

approvedAt.description: Date at which the supplier approved this mandate.

supplierStatus.description: Last status that the supplier reported for this mandate.

inserted.description: The timestamp this mandate was created at.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp this mandate was last updated at.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.Mandates.Mand.description:
Represents a Direct Debit mandate entity that contains customer, 
 bank account and mandate information.

merchantID.description: Merchant ID that this mandate is associated with.

addressLine1.description: First line of the customer's address.

addressLine2.description: Second line of the customer's address. Optional.

countryCode.description: 2-character country code of the customer's bank account.

iban.description: IBAN of the customer's bank account in case of EUR account.

accountNumber.description: Account number of the customer's bank account in case of GBP account.

sortCode.description: Sort code of the customer's bank account in case of GBP account.

reference.description: Field that you can use as reference.

isRecurring.description: Indicates whether this mandate is single-use or recurring.

name.description: The registered business name of the merchant.

companyID.description: The Company ID recorded in the Compliance system.

merchantCategoryCode.description: The industry code that represents the merchant's primary trading activity.

shortName.description:
A URL friendly shortish name for the merchant. Principal purpose is
to use in the hosted payment page URL.

tradingName.description: An optional trading name. If not set the Name field will be used .

paymentAccountLimit.description:
The maximum number of payment accounts that can be created for the Merchant.
To increase the limit contact support.

inserted.description: Timestamp the merchant was added to MoneyMoov.

jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction the merchant entity is incorporated or established in.

hostedPayVersion.description: The version of the hosted payment page to use with the merchant.

webHookLimit.description:
The maximum number of web hooks that can be created for the Merchant.
To increase the limit contact support.

displayQrOnHostedPay.description:
Indicates if a QR Code containing the payment link should be displayed
on the hosted payment page.

supportedPaymentMethodsList.description: The payment methods that are configured and supported for this merchant.

yourRoleName.description: The name of the role for the identity that loaded the merchant record.

logoUrlPng.description: The CDN URL of the merchant's logo in PNG format.

logoUrlSvg.description: The CDN URL of the merchant's logo in SVG format.

tags.description:
An optional list of descriptive tags that can be used on merchant entities
such as payment requests.

accountCurrencies.description: The list of currencies that the merchant has accounts for.

pageNumber.description: Current page number. Its 1 based. i.e firstpage is 1, secondpage is 2

bankID.description: ID of the bank to be configured for the merchant.

order.description: Order in which this setting will appear in the UI.

processor.description: Name of the bank payment processor.

personalInstitutionID.description: ID that the processor uses to identify the bank (personal accounts).

businessInstitutionID.description: ID that the processor uses to identify the bank (business accounts).

messageImageUrl.description: Optional image URL to be displayed with the message.

bankCountryCodes.description: The list of country codes representing the banks the country supports.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.MerchantPayBy.description: Represents an individual bank payment setting.

merchantID.description: Merchant to which the settings will be configured.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.MerchantPayBy.description: Represents a collection of merchant bank payment settings.

permissionTypes.description: The permissions that the merchant token supports.

token.description:
The JWT merchant token. It will only be available when the merchant token is
initially created. The token is not stored by NoFrixion.

isEnabled.description: If set to false the merchant token will not be accepted to authorise a request.

sharedSecretAlgorithm.description: Optional shared secret algorithm to use for HMAC authentication.

sharedSecretBase64.description:
The base 64 encoded shared secret that is used for request authentication with an HMAC.
Note this property will ONLY be set when the token is initially created. It is not possible
to retrieve the secret afterwards. If it is lost a new token should be created.

requestSignatureVersion.description:
Represent the version of the overall merchant token. This field is to allow the secret and public key mechanisms to
vary over time. For example if the HTTP header fields to include in the algorithms change this version will faciliatate
keeping track of which signature versions a particular merchant token is using.

expiresAt.description: Optional. If set indicates the merchant token is not valid after the specified expiry date.

authorisations.description: A list of users who have successfully authorised the latest version of the beneficiary.

canAuthorise.description: True if the merchant token can be authorised by the user who loaded it.

hasCurrentUserAuthorised.description: True if the beneficiary was loaded for a user and that user has already authorised the latest version of the beneficiary.

authorisersRequiredCount.description:
The number of authorisers required for this merchant token. Is determined by business settings
on the source account and/or merchant.

authorisersCompletedCount.description: The number of distinct authorisers that have authorised the merchant token.

authenticationMethods.description: A list of authentication types allowed to authorise the merchant token.

ipAddressWhitelist.description:
Optional. If set represents a comma separated list of IP addresses that this token is authorised to be used from.
Attempts to use the token from an IP address not in the list will be rejected.

isArchived.description: Indicates whether the merchant token is archived.

pageNumber.description: Current page number. Its 1 based. i.e firstpage is 1, secondpage is 2

accountType.description: The type of account e.g. (Credit Card, Savings).

type.description: Specifies the type of account e.g. (BUSINESS_CURRENT).

description.description: Product name as defined by the financial institution for this account.

balance.description: Main or headline balance for the account. Use of this field is recommended as fallback only. Instead, use of the typed balances (accountBalances) is recommended.

currency.description: Currency the bank account balance is denoted in. Specified as a 3-letter ISO 4217 currency code.

nickname.description: Nickname of the account that was provided by the account owner. May be used to aid identification of the account.

details.description: Supplementary specifications that might be provided by the Bank. These provide further characteristics about the account.

accountNames.description: Optional account names set by the account holder.

accountIdentifications.description: The canoncial identifiers for the account.

accountBalances.description: The various balances for the account.

creditLineIncluded.description: _Optional_. Indicates whether any credit lines are included in the balance.

identification.description: The value associated with the account identification type.

name.description: The bank account holder's name given by the account owner.

addressLines.description: The address line of the address.

streetName.description: The street name of the address.

buildingNumber.description: The building number of the address.

postCode.description: The post code of the address.

townName.description: The town name of the address.

county.description: The list of counties for the address.

country.description: The 2-letter country code for the address. Institution's; may require you to specify the country when used in the context of the Payee to be able to make a payment.

addressLine.description: Information, in free format text, that identifies a specific address.

successWebHookUrl.description:
A web hook URL to send an HTTP request to when the open banking consent
is successfuly authorised. This web hook lets the calling application 
know when a consent is ready to be used.

failureCallbackUrl.description:
Optional callback URL for open banking consent authorisation failure. 
If the URL is set, the calling application will be redirected here with the error message.
If its not set it will fall back on default page that will show the error message.

provider.description: Lists the supported card and PIS processors.

emailAddress.description:
The email address that identifies the end user that will be authorising the 
open banking consent request.

institutionID.description: The institution ID the open banking consent is being requested for.

merchantID.description: The ID of the merchant the consent token is being created to be used with.

callbackUrl.description:
Optional callback URL that the end user performing the open banking authorisation
will be redirected to on completion. Typically this should be a URL that takes the 
user back to the application that they originally started the open banking authorisation
from.

successWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL that will be called by the MoneyMoov server upon a successful open banking
authorisation. The webhook URL will pass a single parameter of "id". That ID can
then be used in the MoneyMoov open banking actions to verify the operation. Note
web hooks can easily be spoofed and should NOT be trusted without calling back to the 
 MoneyMoov server for verification.

failureCallbackUrl.description:
Optional URL for open banking consent authorisation failure. 
If the URL is set, the calling application will be redirected here with the error
message as query parameter. If its not set it will fall back on default page that
will show the error message.

isConnectedAccounts.description:
Optional setting. If connected accounts is enabled. After a successful consent authorisation,
NoFrixion will pull all authorised EUR and GBP account information and store them along NoFrixion payment accounts.

consentID.description:
The ID of the open banking consent. Once the consent has been authorised this
is the ID that allows it to be utilised via the open banking APIs to list accounts,
transactions etc.

authorisationUrl.description:
The URL the authorising user needs to be redirected to in order to get the open banking
consent token.

id.description:
Identifier of the consolidated account. When used in Get Account Transactions calls, the transactions 
between the sub-accounts will not be reported.

accountBalances.description: The various balances for the account.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.OpenBanking.C.description: Summary information regarding account balances of the overall account provided by the bank.

sourceCurrency.description: Currency from which an amount is to be converted.

targetCurrency.description: Currency to which an amount is to be converted.

unitCurrency.description: The currency in which the rate of exchange is expressed in a currency exchange. In the example 1GBP the unit currency is GBP.

exchangeRate.description:
The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was 
bought with another currency.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.OpenBanking.C.description: Provides details on the currency exchange.

name.description: The account holder name of the beneficiary.

accountIdentifications.description: The account identifications that identify the Payee  bank account.

merchantId.description: The merchant ID is a unique code provided by the payment processor to the merchant.

merchantCategoryCode.description: The category code of the merchant in case the Payee is a business.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.OpenBanking.P.description: The Payee object contains details of the beneficiary, person or business.

name.description: The account holder name of the Payer.

accountIdentifications.description: The account identifications that identify the Payer; bank account.

merchantID.description: The ID of the merchant that owns the account.

balanceMinorUnits.description: Balance of the account expressed in the currencys minor units (e.g. cents, pence).

submittedPayoutsBalance.description: Total of the payouts that have been submitted for processing.

submittedPayoutsBalanceMinorUnits.description: The balance of the submitted payouts expressed in the currencys minor units (e.g. cents, pence).

inserted.description: Timestamp when the account was created.

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the account was last updated.

currency.description: Currency of the account in ISO 4217 format

displayName.description:
Gets a unique display name for the payment account. Useful for when payment accounts need to 
be listed.

summary.description: Gets a summary of the payments account's most important properties.

availableBalance.description: The current available balance of the account. Calculated by subtracting any submitted payments from the current balance.

availableBalanceMinorUnits.description: The available balance expressed in the currencys minor units (e.g. cents, pence).

accountSupplierName.description: The payment account supplier name. A payment account can be supplied by multiple payment processors.

isConnectedAccount.description:
Indicates if the payment account is an externally connected account.
Externally connected account can be used to view account balances and transactions.

consentID.description: The ID of the consent used to connect the external account.

bankName.description: The bank name for external accounts

expiryDate.description: The date that the external account will expire

isTrustAccount.description:
Indicates if the payment account is a trust account. The account name is displayed in the statement
instead of the merchant name for trust accounts.

xeroBankFeedConnectionStatus.description: States the status of the Xero bank feed connection, if applicable.

xeroUnsynchronisedTransactionsCount.description: Indicates the number of unsynchronised transactions with Xero

createdByDisplayName.description: Either the name of the user, merchant token or api key that created the account

defaultPaymentRail.description:
Indicates the default payment rail for this account. Normally it will be left as the
default value but in some special cases it may be set to indicate payouts from this account
should be attempted with a specific payment rail.

rules.description: The list of rules associated with this account.

isArchived.description:
Indicates whether the account is archived. Archived accounts are not displayed in the UI.
If an account receives a payment it will be automatically unarchived.

supplierSepaInstantStatus.description: Indicates the status of the SEPA Instant payment rail for this account.

physicalAccountID.description: For virtual accounts this is the ID of the physical account that the virtual account is linked to.

isVirtual.description: True if the account is a virtual account.

merchantID.description: The ID of the merchant the payment account is being created for.

currency.description: Currency for the account, only EUR, GBP, USD and in sandbox BTC are supported.

accountName.description:
The name for the account. This name is descriptive only, and will not be
used when sending payments, but it should still be set to something that 
identifies the purpose of the funds. For example "EUR Payment" would be
suitable to for an account used for general purpose business payments.

supplierPhysicalAccountID.description: For internal use only. Leave empty unless requested otherwise.

accountType.description:
If specified the account type will be set to the specified value
disregarding the merchant default account type.

tribeAccountId.description: If creating a Tribe account type, then this is the tribe account id

physicalAccountID.description:
For EUR accounts this can be set to the ID of another account that will act as the
backing phyiscal account. The new account will then act as a Virtual account, able to 
receive funds but the transactions will be recorded aginst the backing physical account.

isTrustAccount.description:
Optional property to indicate whether the account is a trust account.
The account name is displayed on the statement for trust accounts instead of the merchant name.

roleIDs.description:
Optional list of role IDs that will get access to the payment account when created.
Creator user's roles will always be able to access the account.
If not specified, the account will be accessible by all the merchant's roles.
If specified as an empty list, the account will only be accessible by the creator user.

pageNumber.description: Current page number. Its 1 based. i.e firstpage is 1, secondpage is 2

paymentInitiationID.description: The unique identifier of the payment initiation request.

redirectUrl.description: A redirect URL for the user to authorise the payment initiation request at the ASPSP

paymentRequestCallbackUrl.description:
The callback URL that was set when the payment request was created. Payers will be 
redirected to this URL after a successful payment initiation.

amount.description: The amount of money to request.

customerID.description: An optional customer identifier for the payment request.

orderID.description:
An optional order ID for the payment request. If the request is for an invoice this
is the most appropriate field for the invoice ID.

paymentMethods.description: The payment methods that the payment request supports.

description.description:
An optional description for the payment request. If set this field will appear
on the transaction record for some card processors.

pispAccountID.description:
The payment account ID to use to receive payment initiation payments. This must match one of your
NoFrixion payment account IDs. This can be left blank to use your default payment account.

baseOriginUrl.description:
For card payments the origin of the payment page needs to be set in advance.
A public key context is generated to encrypt sensitive card details and is bound
to a single origin URL.

callbackUrl.description:
Once a payment is processed, or a notification of an inbound payment is received,
a callback request will be made to this URL. Typically it will be the page on
a merchant's web site that displays the results of the payment attempt.

failureCallbackUrl.description:
Optional callback URL for payment failures that can occur when the payer is 
redirected away from the payment page. Typically the payer is only sent away
from the payment page for pay by bank attempts. If this URL is not set the 
payer will be redirected back to the original URL the payment attempt was initiated
from.

successWebHookUrl.description:
If a payment event results in the payment request being classified as fully paid this
success webhook URL will be invoked. The URL will be invoked as a GET request, i.e.
there will be no request body. Two query parameters will be added to the URL. The 
first one will be "id" and will hold the payment request ID. The second one will be
"orderid" and will hold the payment request OrderID, note the OrderID could be empty
if it was not set when the payment request was created. 
The recommended approach when receiving a success web hook is to use the "id" parameter
to call the moneymoov get payment request endpoint to retrieve the full details of the
payment request and check the status. Web hooks can be easily spoofed and should not be
relied upon.

cardAuthorizeOnly.description:
For card payments the default behaviour is to authorise and capture the payment at the same
time. If a merchant needs to authorise and then capture at a later point this property needs
to be set to true.

cardCreateToken.description:
For card payments a payment attempt can be used to create a reusable token for subsequent
payments. Setting this field to true will create a reusable customer token.

cardCreateTokenMode.description:
This specifies whether user consent will be taken before tokenising card or not.
If this is set to 'UserConsentRequired' then, the user consent will potentially update 
CardCreateToken flag on submit card payment.

ignoreAddressVerification.description:
If set to true the card payment gateway will be directed to proceed with a payment even if the
address verification checks fails.

cardIgnoreCVN.description:
If set to true the card payment gateway will be directed to proceed with a payment even if the
card verification number check fails.

cardProcessorMerchantID.description:
Optional field that if specified indicates the processor merchant ID that should be used
to process any card payments. Mainly useful where a merchant has multiple processor
merchant ID's. If left empty the default merchant card settings will be used.

paymentProcessor.description:
If the card payment option is enabled this field indicates which card processor
the merchant is set up to use.

lightningInvoice.description: Bitcoin Lightning invoice for the payment request.

status.description:
The current status of the payment request. Will be set to FullyPaid when the full
amount has been received.

hostedPayCheckoutUrl.description:
This is a convenience link generated for payment requests whose merchants are using
hosted payment pages. The link will load the MoneyMoov hosted payment page. If the 
merchant has not been set up for hosted payment or the payment can't be hosted then
this property will be empty.

partialPaymentMethod.description: The approach to use, or not, for accepting partial payments.

inserted.description: The timestamp the payment request was created at.

insertedSortable.description:
The Inserted timestamp output as a sortable string 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings#UniversalSortable 
Format also supported natively by Javascript https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-date-time-string-format.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp the payment request was last updated at.

useHostedPaymentPage.description:
If set to true, and the merchant is configured for hosted payment pages, the base and callback URLs
will be set to use the hosted payment page.

customerEmailAddress.description:
Optional email address for the customer. If the tokenise card option is set then the customer email address
is mandatory.

cardStripePaymentIntentID.description: If Stripe is being used as the card payment processor this property is used to hold the Stripe payment intent ID.

cardStripePaymentIntentSecret.description: If Stripe is being used as the card payment processor this property is used to hold the Stripe payment intent client secret.

tags.description: An optional list of descriptive tags attached to the payment request.

jwk.description: The jwk containing the public key used to verify the signature of the payment request.

priorityBankID.description: The ID of the bank that is set as the priority bank for display on pay element.

title.description:
A generic field to contain any additional data that the merchant wishes to store against the payment request.
E.g. product or service information.

partialPaymentSteps.description:
An optional comma separated list of partial payment amounts. The amounts represent guidance, or suggestions, as to
how the payer will be requested to make partial payments.

payrunID.description:
The ID of a payrun that needs an account top up. 
Payment request can be used to top up payrun accounts.

paymentAttempts.description: The payment attempts made against this payment request.

amountReceived.description: Total amount received for this payment request.

amountRefunded.description: Total amount refunded for this payment request.

amountPending.description: Total amount that has been authorised but not settled for this payment request.

merchantTokenDescription.description: Description of the merchant token in case the Payment request was created using a merchant token.

lightningInvoiceExpiresAt.description: Date and time of expiration of the lightning invoice.

autoSendReceipt.description: If set to true, a receipt will be automatically sent to the CustomerEmailAddress when payments are received.

customFields.description: A list of custom fields attached to the payment request.

sandboxSettleDelayInSeconds.description: Sandbox only. Optional. If set, simulated settlements will be delayed by the specified number of seconds.

dueDate.description: The due date for the payment request.

fieldDisplaySettings.description: A list of field display settings that control which fields are displayed to the payer.

notificationRoleIDs.description: A list of roles whose members will receive notifications about this payment request.

capturedAt.description: Date and time the capture was initiated.

captureFailedAt.description: Date and time the capture failed.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.PaymentReques.description: Represents each individual payment capture attempt for a payment request.

merchantID.description: The ID of the merchant to create the payment request for.

amount.description: The amount of money to request.

currency.description: The currency of the payment request.

customerID.description:
An optional customer identifier for the payment request. This field is sent to the 
payer's bank when using payment initiation. The restriction in the available characters
is due to some banks rejecting requests when ones outside the set are used.

orderID.description:
An optional order ID for the payment request. If the request is for an invoice this
is the most appropriate field for the invoice ID.

paymentMethods.description: The payment methods that the payment request supports.

description.description:
An optional description for the payment request. If set this field will appear
on the transaction record for some card processors.

pispAccountID.description:
The payment account ID to use to receive payment initiation payments. This must match one of your
NoFrixion payment account IDs. This can be left blank to use your default payment account.

shippingFirstName.description: Optionally the first name of the customer's shipping address.

shippingLastName.description: Optionally the last name of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressLine1.description: Optionally the first line of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressLine2.description: Optionally the second line of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressCity.description: Optionally the city of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressCounty.description: Optionally the state or county of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressPostCode.description: Optionally the post code of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressCountryCode.description: Optionally the country code of the customer's shipping address.

shippingPhone.description: Optionally the shipping phone number for the customer.

shippingEmail.description: Optionally the shipping email address for the customer.

Once a payment is processed, or a notification of an inbound payment is received,
a callback request will be made to this URL. Typically it will be the page on
a merchant's web site that displays the results of the payment attempt.

failureCallbackUrl.description:
Optional callback URL for payment failures that can occur when the payer is 
redirected away from the payment page. Typically the payer is only sent away
from the payment page for pay by bank attempts. If this URL is not set the 
payer will be redirected back to the original URL the payment attempt was initiated
from.

If a payment event results in the payment request being classified as fully paid this
success webhook URL will be invoked. The URL will be invoked as a GET request, i.e.
there will be no request body. Two query parameters will be added to the URL. The 
first one will be "id" and will hold the payment request ID. The second one will be
"orderid" and will hold the payment request OrderID, note the OrderID could be empty
if it was not set when the payment request was created. 
The recommended approach when receiving a success web hook is to use the "id" parameter
to call the moneymoov get payment request endpoint to retrieve the full details of the
payment request and check the status. Web hooks can be easily spoofed and should not be
relied upon.

For card payments the default behaviour is to authorise and capture the payment at the same
time. If a merchant needs to authorise and then capture at a later point this property needs
to be set to true.

cardCreateToken.description:
For card payments a payment attempt can be used to create a reusable token for subsequent
payments. Setting this field to true will create a reusable customer token.
