This specifies whether user consent will be taken before tokenising card or not.
This cannot be 'None' if CardCreateToken is set to true. If this is set to 'UserConsentRequired'
then, the user consent will overwrite CardCreateToken flag on submit card payment.

cardTransmitRawDetails.description:
If set to true for card payments the sensitive card number and card verification number 
will be transmitted directly rather than being tokenised. This makes the payment quicker
but more exposed to client side flaws such as cross site scripting.

cardProcessorMerchantID.description:
Optional field that if specified indicates the processor merchant ID that should be used
to process any card payments. Mainly useful where a merchant has multiple processor
merchant ID's. If left empty the default merchant card settings will be used.

ignoreAddressVerification.description:
If set to true the card payment gateway will be directed to proceed with a payment even if the
address verification checks fails.

cardIgnoreCVN.description:
If set to true the card payment gateway will be directed to proceed with a payment even if the
card verification number check fails.

useHostedPaymentPage.description:
If set to true, and the merchant is configured for hosted payment pages, the base and callback URLs
will be set to use the hosted payment page.

cardNoPayerAuthentication.description:
If set to true for card payments no attempt will be made to use payer authentication (3-D Secure and equivalent).
Skipping payer authentication can help avoid failed payment attempts when a payer is not enrolled or when they
can't be bothered completing their issuing bank's authentication steps. A disadvantage is it exposes the merchant 
to liability for charge backs.

partialPaymentMethod.description: The approach to use, or not, for accepting partial payments.

customerEmailAddress.description:
Optional email address for the customer. If the tokenise card option is set then the customer email address
is mandatory.

priorityBankID.description: The ID of the bank that is set as the priority bank for display on pay element.

title.description:
A generic field to contain any additional data that the merchant wishes to store against the payment request.
E.g. product or service information.

partialPaymentSteps.description:
An optional comma separated list of partial payment amounts. The amounts represent guidance, or suggestions, as to
how the payer will be requested to make partial payments.

payrunID.description: Optional, if set it indicates that this payment request will be used to top up a payment account for a pay run.

sandboxSettleDelayInSeconds.description:
Sandbox only. Optional. If set, the simulated Direct Debit settlement will be delayed by the specified number of seconds.
Must be greater than 0 and less than 600. Otherwise, the default value will be used.

tagIds.description: An optional list of tag ids to add to the payment request

tags.description:
An optional list of tag values to set on the payment request. If no matching
tag exists it will be created.

autoSendReceipt.description: If set to true, a receipt will be automatically sent to the CustomerEmailAddress when payments are received.

customFields.description:
A list of custom fields to add to the payment request. The custom fields
are data type agnostic which means that the API will not do any validation or formatting
in the key-value pairs. The API will store the custom fields as is.

dueDate.description: An optional due date for the payment request.

fieldDisplaySettings.description:
An optional display settings for the payment request fields. This allows the merchant to control how
the fields are displayed on the hosted payment page, receipt, etc.

notificationRoleIDs.description:
An optional list of notification role IDs that will receive notifications
about the payment request. This is useful for roles that need to be notified
about payment request events.

cardTokenCustomerID.description:
If the option to create a reusable token for card payments was set this field contains
the token the merchant can store to use for repeat payments.

cardAuthorizationResponseID.description:
For a successful card authorization this field will hold the response ID. If a capture
needs to be performed this is the ID that must be used.

lightningInvoice.description: For Bitcoin Lightning payments this field holds the invoice presented to the payer.

lightningRHash.description: For Bitcoin Lightning payments the hash of the invoice presented to the payer.

pispPaymentServiceProviderID.description:
For a payment initiation this is the service provider ID selected by the payer, typically
the ID for the bank or similar financial institution.

pispPaymentInitiationID.description:
For a payment initiation this is the ID returned by the service provider initiating
the payment for us.

pispRedirectUrl.description:
For a payment initiation this is the redirect URL returned by the service provider
initiating the payment for us. This is the URL the payer is redirected to 
authenticate with their financial institution and authorise the payment.

paymentProcessorName.description:
If the event was for a card payment this is the name of the card processor,
e.g. CyberSource or Checkout, that was used.

pispBankStatus.description:
For payment initiation attempts some providers (e.g. Modulr) will return two status fields. The first
status field is from the provider and the second is from the bank.

refundPayoutID.description: ID of the Payout that was created for refund.

applePayTransactionID.description: Transaction ID received in Apple pay token.

pispPaymentInstitutionName.description:
For a payment initiation this is the name of the financial institution that
is used to initiate and authorise the payment.

originUrl.description:
Optional field that can be set by payment methods, such as pay by bank, that may want to redirect
back to the URL that initiated the attempt in the case of a failure condition.

reconciledTransactionID.description:
For settlement events (only relevant for non-card payments) this is the payin transaction that
the payment request event was reconciled with.

directDebitPaymentID.description: Payment ID issued by the Direct Debit supplier.

directDebitPaymentReference.description: Reference string issued by the Direct Debit supplier.

drirectDebitMandateID.description: The ID of the mandate that was used wehn requesting payment.

cardScheme.description: For card payment events this field holds the scheme of the payer's card, e.g. Visa, Mastercard, etc.

cardExpiryYear.description: For card payment events this field holds the payer's card expiry year.

cardExpiryMonth.description: For card payment events this field holds the payer's card expiry month.

cardLastFourDigits.description: For card payment events this field holds the payer's card last four digits.

cardIssuer.description: For card payment events this field holds the payer's card issuer.

cardIssuerCountry.description: For card payment events this field holds the payer's card issuer country of origin.

unpaid.description: Total payment request count with status None.

partiallyPaid.description: Total payment request count with status PartiallyPaid.

paid.description: Total payment request count with status FullyPaid.

authorized.description: Total payment request count with status Authorized.

totalAmountsByCurrency.description: The total amounts by status and currency.

amount.description: The amount of money to request.

title.description: The title of the payment request.

description.description:
An optional description for the payment request. If set this field will appear
on the transaction record for some card processors.

jwk.description: The jwk containing the public key

paymentMethodsList.description: The payment methods that the payment request supports.

pispError.description: This is the error returned from the bank which is recorded in payment request events.

paymentAttempts.description: The payment attempts for this payment request.

status.description: The status of the payment request.

stripeAccountID.description: Account ID of connected customers in Stripe

countryCode.description: The country code associated with the payment.

customFieldsToDisplay.description: Custom fields to display to the customer.

dueDate.description: The due date of the payment request.

amountReceived.description: The amount of money that has been received for this payment request.

amountRefunded.description: The amount of money that has been refunded for this payment request.

amountPending.description: The amount of money that was authorised but has not arrived in the account yet.

paymentRequestID.description: The ID of the payment request the result is for.

occurredAt.description:
Timestamp the payment occurred. For cards this will be the time the
original authorisation occurred.

paymentMethod.description: The payment type for the received money.

tokenisedCardID.description:
For card payments the merchant can request a reusable token for this payer and
use it to submit subsequent merchant initiated payments.

cardAuthorizationID.description:
For card payments this is the ID from the initial successful authorization or sale.
Required for voids and capture operations.

cardCapturedAmount.description: The captured amount for a card payment.

cardIsVoided.description: If true indicates that the card payment was voided.

paymentProcessor.description: The card processor that was used for the payment event.

attemptKey.description:
For pay by bank attempts this is the ID that gets set on all the events (initiate,
callback, webhook and settlement) for the same attempt. For cards and lightning different
fields are used to group payment request events.

paymentRequestID.description: The ID of the payment request the result is for.

initiatedAt.description: Timestamp the payment was initiated at.

authorisedAt.description: If the attempt was authorised this is the timestamp it occurred at.

cardAuthorisedAt.description: If the card payment attempt was authorised this is the timestamp it occurred at.

cardPayerAuthenticationSetupFailedAt.description:
If the card payment attempt authorisation was not succesfully set up
this is the timestamp it occurred at.

cardAuthoriseFailedAt.description:
If the card payment attempt was not succesfully authorised this is the timestamp
it occurred at.

settledAt.description: If the PISP attempt was settled this is the timestamp it occurred at.

settleFailedAt.description:
If the PISP attempt failed to settled after the expected settlement time this
is the timestamp the failure was recorded at.

paymentMethod.description: The payment type for the received money.

authorisedAmount.description: The payment amount that was authorised by the payer.

cardAuthorisedAmount.description: The card payment amount that was authorised by the payer.

settledAmount.description: The funds that were received from the payer.

refundAttempts.description: The refund attempts associated with this payment attempt.

captureAttempts.description: The card capture attempts associated with this payment attempt.

paymentProcessor.description: The card processor that was used for the payment event.

institutionID.description:
Where available this is the ID of the institution used by the payer. For example in PIS attempts
this will be the ID of the bank the payer used for the attempt.

institutionName.description:
Where available this is the name of the institution used by the payer. For example,
in PIS attempts this will be the name of the bank the payer used for the attempt.

tokenisedCardID.description:
For card payments the merchant can request a reusable token for this payer and
use it to submit subsequent merchant initiated payments.

reconciledTransactionID.description:
When the payment attempt is settled (only relevant for non-card payments) this is the payin transaction that
the payment request event was reconciled with.

pispAuthorisationFailedAt.description: Timestamp for PSIP bank authorisation error or failure.

isPaid.description: True once the attempt has actually been paid (card authorised or settled).

paidAt.description: The time the payment went through (card authorisation time or settlement time).

paidAmount.description: The amount that was actually paid.

paymentRequestID.description: The ID of the payment request the result is for.

result.description: The result of the payment attempt.

requestedAmount.description: The full original payment amount requested.

payments.description: The list of payment attempts that have been received for the payment request.

customerID.description:
An optional customer identifier for the payment request. This field is sent to the 
payer's bank when using payment initiation. The restriction in the available characters
is due to some banks rejecting requests when ones outside the set are used.

orderID.description:
An optional order ID for the payment request. If the request is for an invoice this
is the most appropriate field for the invoice ID.

paymentMethods.description: The payment methods that the payment request supports.

description.description:
An optional description for the payment request. If set this field will appear
on the transaction record for some card processors.

pispAccountID.description:
The payment account ID to use to receive payment initiation payments. This must match one of your
NoFrixion payment account IDs. This can be left blank to use your default payment account.

shippingFirstName.description: Optionally the first name of the customer's shipping address.

shippingLastName.description: Optionally the last name of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressLine1.description: Optionally the first line of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressLine2.description: Optionally the second line of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressCity.description: Optionally the city of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressCounty.description: Optionally the state or county of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressPostCode.description: Optionally the post code of the customer's shipping address.

shippingAddressCountryCode.description: Optionally the country code of the customer's shipping address.

shippingPhone.description: Optionally the shipping phone number for the customer.

shippingEmail.description: Optionally the shipping email address for the customer.

baseOriginUrl.description:
For card payments the origin of the payment page needs to be set in advance.
A public key context is generated to encrypt sensitive card details and is bound
to a single origin URL.

callbackUrl.description:
Once a payment is processed, or a notification of an inbound payment is received,
a callback request will be made to this URL. Typically it will be the page on
a merchant's web site that displays the results of the payment attempt.

failureCallbackUrl.description:
Optional callback URL for payment failures that can occur when the payer is 
redirected away from the payment page. Typically the payer is only sent away
from the payment page for pay by bank attempts. If this URL is not set the 
payer will be redirected back to the original URL the payment attempt was initiated
from.

cardAuthorizeOnly.description:
For card payments the default behaviour is to authorise and capture the payment at the same
time. If a merchant needs to authorise and then capture at a later point this property needs
to be set to true.

cardCreateToken.description:
For card payments a payment attempt can be used to create a reusable token for subsequent
payments. Setting this field to true will create a reusable customer token.

cardCreateTokenMode.description:
This specifies whether user consent will be taken before tokenising card or not.
This cannot be 'None' if CardCreateToken is set to true. If this is set to 'UserConsentRequired'
then, the user consent will overwrite CardCreateToken flag on submit card payment.

cardProcessorMerchantID.description:
Optional field that if specified indicates the processor merchant ID that should be used
to process any card payments. Mainly useful where a merchant has multiple processor
merchant ID's. If left empty the default merchant card settings will be used.

customerEmailAddress.description:
Optional email address for the customer. If the tokenise card option is set then the customer email address
is mandatory.

title.description:
A generic field to contain any additional data that the merchant wishes to store against the payment request.
E.g. product or service information.

partialPaymentSteps.description:
An optional comma separated list of partial payment amounts. The amounts represent guidance, or suggestions, as to
how the payer will be requested to make partial payments.

tagIds.description: An optional list of tag ids to add to the payment request

lightningInvoice.description: Bitcoin Lightning invoice for the payment request.

lightningInvoiceExpiresAt.description: Date and time of expiration of the lightning invoice.

autoSendReceipt.description: If set to true, a receipt will be automatically sent to the CustomerEmailAddress when payments are received.

customFields.description:
A list of custom fields to add to the payment request. The custom fields
are data type agnostic which means that the API will not do any validation or formatting
in the key-value pairs. The API will store the custom fields as is.

dueDate.description: The due date of the payment request.

successWebHookUrl.description:
If a payment event results in the payment request being classified as fully paid this
success webhook URL will be invoked. The URL will be invoked as a GET request, i.e.
there will be no request body. Two query parameters will be added to the URL. The 
first one will be "id" and will hold the payment request ID. The second one will be
"orderid" and will hold the payment request OrderID, note the OrderID could be empty
if it was not set when the payment request was created. 
The recommended approach when receiving a success web hook is to use the "id" parameter
to call the moneymoov get payment request endpoint to retrieve the full details of the
payment request and check the status. Web hooks can be easily spoofed and should not be
relied upon.

paymentRequestID.description: The ID of the payment request the pisp authorization is for.

paymentMethod.description: The payment type for the received money.

pispPaymentInitiationID.description:
For a payment initiation this is the ID returned by the service provider initiating
the payment for us.

name.description: The name of the custom field.

value.description: The value of the custom field.

displayOnHostedPaymentPage.description: If true, the custom field will be displayed on the hosted payment page.

displayOnPaymentReceipt.description: If true, the custom field will be displayed on the payment receipt.

displayOrder.description:
The display order of the custom field. The lowest number is displayed first.
This is used to determine the order in which the custom fields are displayed
on the UI, for example, on the hosted payment page and payment receipt.

field.description: The field for which the display settings are defined.

displayOnHostedPaymentPage.description: If false, the field will not be displayed on the hosted payment page.

displayOnPaymentReceipt.description: If false, the field will not be displayed on the payment receipt.

defaultFields.description:
A list of default fields that are included in the payment request template.
These fields are predefined and map to concrete fields in the payment request.

customFields.description: A list of custom fields that can be included in the payment request template.

displayOrder.description:
The display order of the custom field. The lowest number is displayed first.
This can be used to determine the order in which 
the fields are displayed when creating a payment request.

defaultField.description:
This enum defines the type of field in a payment request template. 
It is one of the predefined types that map to
concrete fields in the payment request.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.PaymentReques.description:
This represents a default field in a payment request template. 
Default fields are predefined fields that map to concrete payment request properties.

payrunID.description: The ID of the payrun that this payout is associated with.

accountID.description: Gets or Sets Account Id of sending account

merchantID.description: The ID of the merchant that owns the account.

userID.description: Gets or Sets User ID of who created the payout request

approverID.description: Gets the User ID of person that approved the payout.

topupPayrunID.description:
The ID of a payrun that needs an account top up. 
Payouts can be used to top up payrun accounts.

description.description: Gets or Sets description of payout request

currency.description: Gets or Sets Currency of payout request

amountMinorUnits.description: The payout amount expressed in the currencys minor units (e.g. cents, pence).

yourReference.description: Gets or Sets your reference ID

theirReference.description: Gets or Sets destination reference ID

canProcess.description: If set to true indicates the payout has been flagged as safe to process after transaction monitoring.

batchPayoutID.description: The ID of the batch the payout is associated with.

status.description: Gets or Sets the status of payout request

currentUserID.description:
The ID of the user that requested access to the PayOut record. Note
this is NOT necessarily the user that created it.

approvePayoutUrl.description:
This field is used when returning an payout record to a client. If set it holds the URL
the user needs to visit in order to complete a strong authentication check in order to approve 
the payout.

sourceAccountCurrency.description: The currency of the source account.

sourceAccountName.description: The name of the account the payout is being made from.

sourceAccountIban.description: The IBAN of the account the payout is being made from.

sourceAccountNumber.description: The account number of the account the payout is being made from.

sourceAccountSortcode.description: The sort code of the account the payout is being made from.

sourceAccountBic.description: The BIC of the account the payout is being made from.

sourceAccountAvailableBalance.description: The available balance of the account the payout is being made from.

sourceAccountAvailableBalanceMinorUnits.description: The available balance of the source account expressed in the currencys minor units (e.g. cents, pence).

formattedSourceAccountAvailableBalance.description: The available balance of the account the payout is being made from.

invoiceID.description:
Optional field to associate the payout with the invoice from an external 
application such as Xero. The InvoiceID needs to be unique for each
account.

tags.description: An optional list of descriptive tags attached to the payout.

scheduled.description: Should this payout be scheduled for a future date?

scheduleDate.description: The date the payout should be submitted.

authorisersRequiredCount.description:
The number of authorisers required for this payout. Is determined by business settings
on the source account and/or merchant.

authorisersCompletedCount.description: The number of distinct authorisers that have authorised the payout.

canAuthorise.description: True if the payout can be authorised by the user who loaded it.

canUpdate.description: True if the payout can be updated by the user who loaded it.

hasCurrentUserAuthorised.description: True if the payout was loaded for a user and that user has already authorised the latest version of the payout.

authorisations.description: A list of the users who have successfully authorised the latest version of the payout and when.

authenticationMethods.description: A list of authentication types allowed to authorise the payout.

payrunName.description: The name of the payrun that this payout is associated with.

paymentProcessor.description: The usptream payment processor for the payout.

events.description: The activity associated with the payout.

paymentRail.description:
Optional field to indicate the payment rail to use for the payout. Currrently only
supports choosing between SEPA-CT and SEPA-INST for EUR payments. If not set, for a EUR
payment, the default behaviour is to attempt SEPA-INST and fallback to SEPA-CT if rejected.

chargeBearer.description:
Optional field to set who should pay any fees for the payout. Typically only
used for international payments and ignored for SEPA and Faster Payments.

isSubmitted.description:
Indicates whether the payout has been submitted for processing. Once submitted the payout
amount is reserved until the payout is marked as failed or settled.

isFailed.description:
Set to true if a submitted payout subsequently fails. If a payout fails the amount is
remvoed from the account's reserved balance.

isSettled.description:
Set to true if a payout was successfully processed and the corresponding transaction has been
recorded on the ledger.

fxDestinationCurrency.description: For an FX payout this is the currency to send to the beneficiary.

fxRate.description: For an FX payout this is the exchange rate to use for the payout.

fxDestinationAmount.description:
If specified this will be the amount sent to the payee. The payout's Amount will be dynamically adjusted based on 
this amount and the FX rate.

fxUseDestinationAmount.description:
For a multi-currency payout this indicates how the Amount and FxDestinationAmount are treated.
If true the FxDestinationAmount is authoritative and the Amount is set based on the FxRate. If false then the Amount is authoritative
and the FxDestinationAmount is set based on the Amount and FxRate.

fxDestinationAmountMinorUnits.description: The payout FxDestinationAmount expressed in the currencys minor units (e.g. cents, pence).

formattedFxDestinationAmount.description: FX destination currency and amount formatted string.

accountID.description: The ID of the source account for the payout.

type.description: The type of account identifier to use for the payout destination.

amount.description:
Optional but one of Amount or FxDestinationAmount must be set. 
- For single currency payouts this property is mandatory. 
 - For multi-currency payouts this property is optional. If FxDestinationAmount is set this field must be set to 0
and it will be dynamically adjusted based on the FX rate.

yourReference.description: Gets or Sets the your reference property.

invoiceID.description:
Optional field to associate the payout with the invoice from an external 
application such as Xero. The InvoiceID needs to be unique for each
account.

allowIncomplete.description:
If set to true the payout will get created even if the business validation 
rules fail. The basic data validation rules must still pass. The original 
purpose of this flag was to allow payouts to be created from i3rd party applications,
such as Xero, that may not have things like an IBAN set for a supplier.
The missing information must be filled, either by an update from the 3rd party
application, or manually, before the payout can be submitted for processing.

tagIds.description: An optional list of tag ids to add to the payout.

scheduled.description: Should this payout be scheduled for a future date?

scheduleDate.description: The date the payout should be submitted.

beneficiaryID.description: Optional. The ID of the beneficiary to use for the payout destination.

batchPayoutID.description: The ID of the batch payout this payout is part of.

topupPayrunID.description:
Optional, if set it indicates that this payout will be used to top up 
a payment account for a pay run by an internal transfer.

paymentRail.description:
Optional field to indicate the payment rail to use for the payout. Currrently only
supports choosing between SEPA-CT and SEPA-INST for EUR payments. If not set, for a EUR
payment, the default behaviour is to attempt SEPA-INST and fallback to SEPA-CT if rejected.

documents.description:
List of documents to attach to the payout. Optional.
Used for identifying or associating documents with the payout.

chargeBearer.description:
Optional field to set who should pay any fees for the payout. Typically only
used for international payments and ignored for SEPA and Faster Payments.

fxDestinationCurrency.description: Optional. For an FX payout this is the currency that the beneficiary should be sent.

fxDestinationAmount.description:
Optional but one of Amount or FxDestinationAmount must be set. If specified this will be the amount sent to the payee.
The payout's Amount will be dynamically adjusted based on this amount and the FX rate.

fxUseDestinationAmount.description:
For a multi-currency payout this indicates how the Amount and FxDestinaationAmount are treated.
If true the FxDestinationAmount is authoritative and the Amount is set based on the FxRate. If false then the Amount is authoritative
and the FxDestinationAmount is set based on the Amount and FxRate.

description.description: Additional information about the document. Optional.

currency.description: Currency of the document, if applicable. Optional.

amount.description: Amount of the document, if applicable. Optional.

externalID.description: Allows to associate an external ID to the document. Optional.

NoFrixion.MoneyMoov.Models.PayoutDocumen.description: Used for returning a payout document.

description.description: Additional information about the document. Optional.

currency.description: Currency of the document, if applicable. Optional.

amount.description: Amount of the document, if applicable. Optional.

externalID.description: Allows to associate an external ID to the document. Optional.

userID.description: The user id of the user who the event is for.

userName.description: The user name of the user who the event is for.

ruleName.description: The name of the rule that triggered the event.

errorReason.description: Reason for the error, if any.

inProgress.description: Payouts with Pending, Queued or QueuedUpstream status.

pendingApproval.description: Payouts with PendingApproval or PendingInput status.

failed.description: Payouts with Failed, Rejected or Unknown status.

totalAmountsByCurrency.description: The total amounts by status and currency.

accountID.description: The ID of the source account for the payout.

allowIncomplete.description:
If set to true the payout will get updated even if the business validation 
rules fail. The basic data validation rules must still pass. The original 
purpose of this flag was to allow payouts to be created from i3rd party applications,
such as Xero, that may not have things like an IBAN set for a supplier.
The missing information must be filled, either by an update from the 3rd party
application, or manually, before the payout can be submitted for processing.

tagIds.description: An optional list of tag ids to add to the payout.

scheduled.description: Should this payout be scheduled for a future date?

scheduleDate.description: The date the payout should be submitted.

paymentRail.description:
Optional field to indicate the payment rail to use for the payout. Currrently only
supports choosing between SEPA-CT and SEPA-INST for EUR payments. If not set, for a EUR
payment, the default behaviour is to attempt SEPA-INST and fallback to SEPA-CT if rejected.

chargeBearer.description:
Optional field to set who should pay any fees for the payout. Typically only
used for international payments and ignored for SEPA and Faster Payments.

fxDestinationCurrency.description: Optional. For an FX payout this is the currency that the beneficiary should be sent.

fxDestinationAmount.description:
Optional but one of Amount or FxDestinationAmount must be set. If specified this will be the amount sent to the payee.
The payout's Amount will be dynamically adjusted based on this amount and the FX rate.

fxUseDestinationAmount.description:
For a multi-currency payout this indicates how the Amount and FxDestinaationAmount are treated.
If true the FxDestinationAmount is authoritative and the Amount is set based on the FxRate. If false then the Amount is authoritative
and the FxDestinationAmount is set based on the Amount and FxRate.

authorisersRequiredCount.description:
The number of authorisers required for this payrun. Is determined by business settings
on the source account and/or merchant.

authorisersCompletedCount.description: The number of distinct authorisers that have authorised the payrun.

canAuthorise.description: True if the payrun can be authorised by the user who loaded it.

hasCurrentUserAuthorised.description: True if the payrun was loaded for a user and that user has already authorised the latest version of the payrun.

authorisations.description: A list of the users who have successfully authorised the latest version of the payrun and when.

payRunID.description: The ID of the pay run this invoice belongs to.

name.description: Optional. The name of the invoice.

paymentTerms.description: Optional additional information about the invoice.

dueDate.description: Date by which payment is due.

discounts.description: Optional. Any discounts applied to the invoice.

taxes.description: Optional. The total amount of taxes applied to the invoice.

totalAmount.description: Final total amount of the invoice, including discounts and taxes.

outstandingAmount.description: The amount that is still outstanding for this invoice.

subTotal.description: Optional. The total amount before discounts and taxes.

remittanceEmail.description: Email address to which a remittance note will be sent, if specified.

paymentReference.description:
The reference sent to the recipient's bank. If left empty, 
an autogenerated reference will be used instead.

externalInvoiceID.description: If this invoice was created from an external invoice, this will be the ID of the external invoice.

externalInvoiceProvider.description:
If this invoice was created from an external invoice, this will be the provider of the external invoice.
E.g., "Xero", "QuickBooks", etc.

roleID.description: The ID of the role the user has.

merchantID.description: The ID of the merchant the role is in.

roleName.description: The name of the role the user has.

scope.description: The number of accounts the user has access to in the merchant for the role.

assignedAt.description: The date the role was assigned to the user on the merchant.

merchantID.description: The ID of the merchant that owns the account.

approveUrl.description:
If set this property holds the URL an approver needs to visit in order to
complete a strong authentication check in order to approve the rule.

onApprovedWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL to receive an HTTP request with the rule details when the rule status changes to 
approved. The webhook payload will contain the full Rule object.

onExecutionErrorWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL to receive an HTTP request when a rule execution attempt fails. The webhook 
payload will contain a Problem object.

onExecutionSuccessWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL to receive an HTTP request when a rule execution attempt succeeds. The webhook 
payload will contain a list of any payouts that were submitted for the rule execution.

webHookSecret.description: If set this secret will be used to sign Web Hook requests.

lastRunAtTransactionDate.description: The most recent transaction date when the rule was last run.

authorisations.description: A list of the users who have successfully authorised the latest version of the rule and when.

authorisersRequiredCount.description: The number of authorisers required for this rule.

authorisersCompletedCount.description: The number of distinct authorisers that have authorised the rule.

canAuthorise.description: True if the rule can be authorised by the user who loaded it.

hasCurrentUserAuthorised.description: True if the current user has authorised.

authenticationMethods.description: A list of authentication types allowed to authorise the payout.

accountID.description: The ID of the account the rule will apply to.

name.description: A name to succinctly describe the rule.

onApprovedWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL to receive an HTTP request with the rule details when the rule status changes to 
approved. The webhook payload will contain the full Rule object.

onExecutionErrorWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL to receive an HTTP request when a rule execution attempt fails. The webhook 
payload will contain a NoFrixionPorblem object.

onExecutionSuccessWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL to receive an HTTP request when a rule execution attempt succeeds. The webhook 
payload will contain a ?.

isDisabled.description: If set to true the rule will be disabled from executing.

triggerOnPayIn.description:
Set to true if the rule execution should be triggered when the account 
receives a pay in (credit).

triggerCronExpression.description:
If the rule should be executed on a recurring schedule this is the expression
that sets the schedule. The expression uses a CRON format.

timeZoneId.description:
If the rule should be executed on a recurring schedule this is the timezone
that the CRON expression should be evaluated in. The default is UTC.

startAt.description:
Optional start time for rule executions. If this value is set the rule will not
be triggered until the start time has been reached.

endAt.description:
Optional end time for rule executions. If this value is set the rule will not
be triggered after the end time has been reached.

webHookSecret.description: If set this secret will be used to sign Web Hook requests.

accountID.description: Account ID the rule is associated with.

name.description: A name to succinctly describe the rule.

onApprovedWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL to receive an HTTP request with the rule details when the rule status changes to 
approved. The webhook payload will contain the full Rule object.

onExecutionErrorWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL to receive an HTTP request when a rule execution attempt fails. The webhook 
payload will contain a NoFrixionPorblem object.

onExecutionSuccessWebHookUrl.description:
Optional URL to receive an HTTP request when a rule execution attempt succeeds. The webhook 
payload will contain a ?.

isDisabled.description: If set to false the rule will be disabled from executing.

triggerOnPayIn.description:
Set to true if the rule execution should be triggered when the account 
receives a pay in (credit).

triggerCronExpression.description:
If the rule should be executed on a recurring schedule this is the expression
that sets the schedule. The expression uses a CRON format.

timeZoneId.description: If the rule should be executed on a recurring schedule this is the timezone

startAt.description:
Optional start time for rule executions. If this value is set the rule will not
be triggered until the start time has been reached.

endAt.description:
Optional end time for rule executions. If this value is set the rule will not
be triggered after the end time has been reached.

webHookSecret.description: If set this secret will be used to sign Web Hook requests.

amountToLeave.description:
The amount to leave in the account once the sweep has been processed.
A value of zero means sweep all funds.

minimumAmountToRunAt.description:
The minimum amount that must be available in order for the sweep to be run.
For example, setting to 1000 means the rule will not execute if the funds
available are less than 1000.

payoutYourReference.description: The pattern to use for the Your Reference value when creating payouts based on the rule.

payoutTheirReference.description: The pattern to use for the Their Reference value when creating payouts based on the rule.

payoutDescription.description: The pattern to use for the Description value when creating payouts based on the rule.

sweepPercentage.description:
The percentage of the total funds in the account when the rule is executed
that should be swept to the destination.

sweepAmount.description: The amount that should be swept to the destination. Ignored if a sweep percentage is set.

priority.description:
The priority of the destination. Lower numbers represent higher priorities, e.g. 0 is the highest priority. 
Relevant when there are multiple destinations in a sweep. The higher priority destinations will be paid first 
and also attributed any remaining balance in the case of an uneven split.

isDisabled.description: If set to true, it indicates that the destiation is disabled and should not be used.

accountID.description:
An optional ID of an internal account the counterparty is associated with. If set
it will take precedence over any other destination details set for the counterparty.

internalAccountName.description: If the counterparty is an internal account, this is the name of the account.

beneficiaryID.description:
Optional ID of a Beneficiary to use for the counterparty destination. If set
it will take precedence over any other destination details, except for AccountID,
set for the counterparty.

name.description:
The name of the counterparty. For a person this should be their full name. For a 
company this should be their registered or trading name.

emailAddress.description:
An email address for the counterparty. Optional to set and depending on the payment
network does not always get set for pay ins.

phoneNumber.description:
A phone number for the counterparty. Optional to set and depending on the payment
network does not always get set for pay ins.

countryCode.description:
A country code for the counterparty. Optional to set and depending on the payment
network does not always get set for pay ins

summary.description: Gets a convenient summary representation of the counterparty.

merchantID.description: The merchant id to add to the token

hmacAlgorithm.description:
Optional shared secret algorithm to use for HMAC authentication. If set a shared secret will be 
returned when the token is intially created but not on any subsequent retrievals.

permissionTypes.description: The list of permissions tho grant to the merchant token.

accountID.description: The ID of the account the transaction belongs to.

accountName.description: The name of the account the transaction belongs to.

merchantID.description: The ID of the merchant that owns the account.

amount.description:
Amount of the transaction. Negative values indicate a pay out debit), positive
values a pay in (credit).

amountMinorUnits.description: Amount of the transaction expressed in the currencys minor units (e.g. cents, pence).

inserted.description: Date when the transaction was inserted into the ledger.

yourReference.description:
For a pay in the reference the sending party attached. For a pay out the 
reference that the payer attached for themselves.

theirReference.description:
For a pay out the reference that the payer attached for the receiving party. For a
pay in this will typically be empty but for internal transactions may contain the
reference the sending party set for themselves.

counterpartySummary.description:
For pay in (credit) transactions this will contain a descriptive string with the 
most important fields about the counterparty.

balance.description: Balance left on the account after the transaction.

balanceMinorUnits.description: Balance on the account expressed in the currencys minor units (e.g. cents, pence).

ruleID.description: ID of the rule that resulted in the transaction.

payoutID.description: ID of the payout that resulted in the transaction.

virtualIBAN.description: If set it indicates the  payin was to a virtual IBAN.

tags.description: An optional list of descriptive tags attached to the transaction.

accountSequenceNumber.description:
The sequence number of transaction on a per account basis. This sequence number is guaranteed to be an arithemtic sequence 
number for all transactions belonging to the same account.

paymentRequestID.description: For Pay by Bank and Direct Debit transactions this will contain the ID of the payment request.

fxCurrency.description: For an FX payout this is the currency that was received or that was instructed.

fxAmount.description: For an FX payout this is the amound in the FX currency.

fxRate.description: For an FX payout this is the exchange rate between the transaction currency and the FX currency.

paymentRequestCustomFields.description: The custom fields that were attached to the payment request that resulted in this transaction.

pageNumber.description: Current page number. Its 1 based. i.e firstpage is 1, secondpage is 2

clientSessionTimeouts.description:
The number of seconds a session for this user should last before expiring.
This is based on the user's role on the merchant. 
This is used to set the session timeout in the client. If not set the client's default
session timeout will be used.

isInviteeRegistered.description: If true, indicates the invitee's email address corresponds to an existing MoneyMoov user.

initialRoleID.description:
The role ID to automatically assign to the merchants very first user.
Typically set by the compliance team when the first user is invited to a new merchant.

merchantID.description:
ID of the merchant the user is being invited to. Can be empty if
provided by the URL.

inviteeEmailAddress.description: Email address of the user being invited.

inviteeFirstName.description: First Name of the user being invited.

inviteeLastName.description: Last Name of the user being invited.

registrationUrl.description:
Optional URL to provide to the invited user to inform them where to
visit to accept the invite.

sendInviteEmail.description:
If set to true an email will be sent to the invitee with instructions on
how to accept the invite.

initialRoleID.description:
The role ID to automatically assign to the merchants very first user. 
This property can only be set when the merchant has no users with roles.
Typically set by the compliance team when the first user is invited to a new merchant.

userInviteID.description:
Optional ID of the invite that is being accepted so the user can be assigned
a role on a new merchant.

name.description: The name of the virtual account.
The name of the virtual account.

resourceTypes.description: The resource types that the webhook will be generated for.

failedNotificationEmailAddress.description: The email address to which notifications about failed webhook deliveries will be sent.

merchantID.description: The ID of the merchant that the webhook is for.

notificationMethod.description: The type of notification that will be sent.

resourceTypes.description: The resource types that the webhook should be generated for.

destinationUrl.description:
The destination URL for the webhook.
Required for webhook notifications.

secret.description:
The secret key required to authenticate webhook notifications. 
Required for webhook notifications.

emailAddress.description:
The recipient email address(es) for notifications. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma, semicolon, or space.
Reruired for email notifications.

failedNotificationEmailAddress.description: The email address to which notifications about failed webhook deliveries will be sent.

notificationMethod.description: The type of notification that will be sent.

JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme.
Enter your JWT access token in the text input below.
Example: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJ...
